episodes.title: The Lownie Report: Monarchy in Crisis and Will Andrew Go to Jail
episodes.description:
Support Andrew on Substack Here! - https://substack.com/@andrewlownie

This week on The Lownie Report, we examine the accelerating fallout from the latest Epstein-related disclosures and their growing political and constitutional impact. As media scrutiny intensifies and public pressure mounts, questions of accountability within the Royal Household — and beyond — are no longer confined to the margins but are entering the mainstream conversation.

Andrew Lownie discusses the responses from the King, the Prince and Princess of Wales, and the broader institutional handling of the crisis, alongside emerging issues involving intelligence briefings, record-keeping, press scrutiny, and potential police developments. The conversation also explores the widening circle of figures touched by the scandal and the implications for the monarchy’s credibility and public trust.

From the role of royal staff and international reporting disparities to publishing, reputation management, and future investigations, this episode offers context, analysis, and perspective on one of the most consequential royal controversies in decades.

episodes.title: The Lownie Report: The Walls are Closing in On Andrew
episodes.description:
A major new release of Epstein Files material has intensified scrutiny of Andrew and Peter Mandelson's relationship with Jeffrey Epstein and raised broader questions about accountability, transparency, and elite power in Britain.

In this episode of The Lownie Report, Andrew Lownie joins James Fairclough to examine the latest disclosures and their implications. They discuss allegations involving Andrew and Sarah Ferguson, questions surrounding Peter Mandelson, and the possibility of legal or parliamentary investigations. The conversation also explores the royal family’s response, Freedom of Information exemptions, intelligence concerns, and the wider political context.

From trade envoy activities and international business links to the symbolic management of royal crises, this discussion situates current developments within a long historical pattern of establishment protection and public pressure.

00:00:00 — Introduction and week’s Epstein Files disclosures
00:00:21 — Possible investigations and palace responsibility
00:00:47 — Mandelson allegations and political implications

episodes.title: The Lownie Report Emergency Podcast: Why Latest Epstein Release is Most Devastating Yet
episodes.description:
Join Andrew on Substack here! - https://andrewlownie.substack.com/p/epstein-files-are-proof-that-the?r=39c5sl

An extra episode of the podcast this week due to the astonishing revelations that have emerged in the last 48 hours. Andrew Lownie and James Fairclough look at what the implications are for all of the principal characters and why this might be a tipping point where the police feel they have no choice but to take action.

We spoke about why King Charles needs to ensure he doesn’t make the same mistakes as his mother, about the KGB/FSB, Putin and Epstein link and about what we now know about the financial relationship between Epstein and Peter Mandelson. We also looked at the Sir Richard Branson connection and the PR advised he was giving to Epstein. 

We also discussed the China role in all of this and the news that Andrew met President Xi on many occasions, with birthday letters to Xi drafted by alleged Chinese spy Yang Tengbo. 

There is a huge amount to process so we will be covering all of this in much more detail in next week’s episode.

episodes.title: Michael Wolff on Why Epstein's Friends Didn't Care about His Conviction
episodes.description:
Why did so many powerful people continue to stand by Jeffrey Epstein even after his arrest and conviction? In this conversation, Michael Wolff explores the social, cultural and political forces that allowed Epstein to remain protected, welcomed, and taken seriously long after the warning signs were clear.

Wolff discusses Epstein’s deep entanglement with Donald Trump, the modelling world of the 1990s, and the unanswered questions surrounding Melania Trump, explaining how status, money and mutual interests created a closed circle resistant to scrutiny.

The discussion also examines why Epstein was feared rather than exposed, why damaging material was never released, and why accountability consistently failed — revealing a deeper contradiction at the heart of elite power and American public life.

00:00:00 Introduction – Epstein, Trump and Melania
00:01:20 The modelling world and shared obsessions
00:03:05 Legal threats, anti-SLAPP laws and subpoenas
00:06:20 The photographs Epstein kept
00:08:20 Why Epstein was afraid to go public
00:10:55 Why powerful friends stuck by Epstein
00:13:40 Epstein and the British royal circle
00:18:15 Deutsche Bank, money and leverage
00:21:15 Rewriting history after the fact
00:24:40 Why no one wants to publish an Epstein book

episodes.title: The Lownie Report: Andrew and Fergie's PR Fightback
episodes.description:
This week on The Lownie Report, Andrew looks at the increasingly confused and contradictory messaging coming out of the House of York.

Andrew’s apparent estrangement from Princess Eugenie is followed almost immediately by a carefully staged photo opportunity with Princess Beatrice and her daughter in Windsor Great Park — raising fresh questions about loyalty, money, and PR strategy.

We also examine the Yorks’ continued financial links to the Middle East, Sarah Ferguson’s unresolved role in the Epstein network, tensions within the wider royal family, and what all this tells us about power, money, and survival inside the modern monarchy.

episodes.title: Michael Wolff: Epstein Was Afraid of Trump
episodes.description:
It was an honour and a privilege to interview Michael Wolff about his extraordinary career that has recently seen him as the key chronicler of Donald Trump, Rupert Murdoch and Jeffrey Epstein. 

We spoke about how Jeffrey Epstein met Princess Diana more than once, about how Epstein was afraid of Trump and about Epstein's meeting with Putin, and how it may have been Michael's book Siege that ultimately led to Epstein's arrest. We also discussed the truth behind the Melania and Epstein connection. 

We also discussed why Epstein's friends looked past his conviction for procuring a minor and why he was so intent on trying to bring down President Trump and why he was ultimately unsuccessful. 

Michael has bravely taken on Melania Trump in a lawsuit that sees him taking action where many far more powerful news organisations seem content to not upset the President and his wife. It's no surprise that thousands of people have donated to his gofundme and I think it's vital that anyone with a few spare pounds considers helping him in his David vs Goliath battle.

https://www.gofundme.com/f/help-michael-wolff-in-his-legal-fight-against-melania-trump

episodes.title: The Lownie Report: Eugenie's Split with Andrew and What’s Really Going on Behind the Scenes?
episodes.description:
Join Andrew on Substack here! - https://substack.com/@andrewlownie?utm_source=user-menu

In this episode of The Lownie Report, historian and royal biographer Andrew Lownie joins James Fairclough to examine the accelerating crisis surrounding Andrew, from his rapid exit from Royal Lodge to reports that Princess Eugenie has cut off contact with her father.

The discussion explores what may be happening behind the scenes: coordinated PR briefings, the role of Sarah Ferguson, the Palace’s crisis management strategy, and whether new revelations connected to Jeffrey Epstein are imminent.

Lownie also revisits the Newsnight interview, the BBC’s handling of the Andrew story, intelligence and law-enforcement reluctance to act, and the long-term risks facing Princesses Beatrice and Eugenie as they try to protect their futures.

episodes.title: The Lownie Report: The Epstein Questions Andrew Needs to Answer
episodes.description:
In this latest episode of The Lownie Report, Andrew Lownie discusses the latest Epstein disclosures — and what they reveal about Andrew, Sarah Ferguson, and the wider failure of institutions to pursue accountability.

Drawing on new material emerging from US court filings, Andrew examines Andrew’s continued silence in the face of repeated opportunities to assist law enforcement, the troubling financial networks that developed during and after his time as Trade Envoy, and the extent to which royal status appears to have shielded him from scrutiny.

We also discuss the implications for the monarchy itself, the role of the Metropolitan Police and the FBI, and why the drip-feed of revelations may yet prove far more damaging than a single moment of reckoning.

episodes.title: Andrew Lownie on Andrew and Fergie's Marriage, Fiery Rows and Arrested Development
episodes.description:
Andrew Lownie reveals the extraordinary inner world of Sarah Ferguson and Prince Andrew — entitlement, chaos, spending, scandal, staff mistreatment, arrested development, and decades of behaviour that shaped the downfall of the Yorks. Including how Andrew cleared the Royal Box at the Royal Albert Hall for him and his mistress. 

From their volatile marriage to selling access, financial recklessness, and their strange 30-year post-divorce partnership. 

Andrew Lownie’s bestselling and explosive new book 'Entitled: The Rise and Fall of the House of York' is out now.

episodes.title: Andrew Lownie on the Rise and Fall of Fergie and Why Andrew Might End Up in Jail
episodes.description:
Andrew Lownie returns to 'Throwing the Book at Them' for his third in-depth interview about 'Entitled: The Rise and Fall of the House of York'.

Andrew gives us an exclusive new revelation and we spoke about everything that's happened since the book came out three months ago and then focused on Sarah Ferguson's stratospheric rise and fall and how her childhood might hold the key to her behaviour. 

00:00:00 Where the story stands now after the latest leaks

00:24:00 Alleged attempts to discredit Virginia Giuffre and PR lawfare
00:26:00 Why certain tabloids remain sympathetic; access journalism
00:28:00 Early-life aristocratic emotional imprint and abandonment themes

00:36:00 Reports of aggressive arguments and volatile episodes

00:40:00 Freebies, foreign trips, “Knockout,” and slide into vulgarity
00:42:00 The £860k lifestyle economy: gifts, travel, wardrobes
00:44:00 Hoarding, excess buying, generosity as approval mechanism
00:46:00 Charity optics vs. actual outcomes
00:48:00 Parenting reality vs. public image
00:50:00 Sunninghill atmosphere, exclusion, and silent family distances
00:52:00 Gate-racing temper, smashed plates, Windsor anger patterns
00:54:00 Everything transactional: tickets, invites, introductions
00:56:00 Diana & Fergie: rivalry, leaks, reconciliation, fracture
00:58:00 Reputation management after 1997
01:00:00 Fergie & Epstein: logs, contact timeline, contradictions
01:02:00 The 2011 letter vs. later condemnations
01:04:00 Media choreography around interviews and PR containment
01:06:00 What Andrew and Fergie do now: private deals
01:08:00 What more could emerge
01:10:00 Political collateral: who remains protected and why

01:16:00 Pattern of institutional containment until scandal breaks

episodes.title: Andrew Lownie on how the Palace Cover-up Prolonged the Abuse
episodes.description:
Andrew Lownie discusses the palace cover-up, how Andrew met Epstein and what he's found out since the release of his revelatory book 'Entitled: The Rise and Fall of the House of York'.

episodes.title: Andrew Lownie on Prince Andrew and the Queen's Moral Abdication
episodes.description:
I talked to Andrew Lownie about 'Entitled: The Rise and Fall of the House of York'. We covered Prince Andrew and Epstein, how the Queen knew there were concerns about his behaviour, and the stuff that he couldn't put in the book.
